name: Partnership Firm
shortDescription: Partnership is an association of two or more people formed for the purpose of carrying on a business.
description: Partnership is an association of two or more people formed for the purpose of carrying on a business. Each person in the partnership is known as a partner. In a firm, all the partners are an agent for each other, as well as of the firm. The profits of firm are distributed among the partners according to the terms stated in the partnership deed. Partnership firms are governed by Indian Partnership Act, 1932 in India.

howWeWork.heading: How to get Partnership Firm registered

content.title: Select Registration Product
content.description: Choose your required Registration and Add-Ons to get maximum discount

content.title: Upload Documents
content.description: Upload all the required Documents and schedule Call with the Lawyer

content.title: File Application
content.description: Lawyer will file your Application and pay the required Government fees

content.title: Get Registration Certificate
content.description: Lawyer will Follow-up and Respond to any objections raised and get your Registration Certificate

deliverables.heading: Deliverables For Incorporation of Partnership Firm

content.description: Name Approval Certificate
Articles of Association and Memorandum of Association
Certification of Incorporation
PAN Number
TAN Number
GST Registration
AXIS or ICICI Zero Balance Current Account

benefits.heading: Benefits of Incorporation of Partnership Firm

content.title: Ease of Formation
content.description: It is easier to form a partnership firm. The partnership firm requires a partnership deed to establish its operation.

content.title: Ownership Rights
content.description: Every partner is assigned a role and responsibility to ensure smooth operation of the firm.  The deed of the partnership ensures that each partner fulfills their responsibility.

content.title: No minimum capital
content.description: A partnership can be started with zero paid up capital as there is no minimum capital required for incorporating a partnership firm.

content.title: Decision Making
content.description: Each partner brings a different expertise and perspective to the partnership. Such unique skill sets and expertise can help the firm make better decisions.

prerequisites.heading: Prerequisites for Incorporation of Partnership Firm

content.description: There should be minimum 2 partners. The maximum number of partners required to form a partnership firm is 50
Permanent Account Number of the firm
Partnership Deed, ID and Address proof of the firm
ID and Address Proof of the partners
GST Certificate

faqs.question: Is it mandatory to register a partnership firm?
faqs.answer: It is not necessary to register a partnership firm, but it is recommended to get your partnership firm registered.

faqs.question: Which law governs partnership in India?
faqs.answer: Partnership firms are governed by the Indian Partnership Act 1932. The act provides provisions for formation and regulation of the partnership firm.

faqs.question: If I have questions regarding my documents or the process, how can I ask?
faqs.answer: Once you purchase any product from the ezyLegal website, you will be credited minutes in your account. You can use these minutes to connect with the Lawyer and ask questions and take guidance from the Expert.

faqs.question: How to register a Partnership Firm in India?
faqs.answer: ezyLegal can help you get your Partnership firm registered and provide you with the right legal guidance. You can schedule your Consultation with an ezyLegal Lawyer and know the detailed process and advantages of registering a Partnership firm.

faqs.question: How will I know the status of the registration process?
faqs.answer: Status updates will be available on the ezyLegal website (www.ezylegal.in) in your secured Account. Additionally, you will be notified on email and WhatsApp.
